item.description:
Opera is one of the most important art forms for everyone to experience at least once. My friend and our fellow Meetup member, Martha Vedrine is performing in one and she is AMAZING! Martha has performed around the country and across the globe.

There are several performances to choose from however I will attend the Saturday April 6th show. Run time 3 hours. Join me then or when you can.

Let me know if you want to get together for a late dinner afterward. Dining possibilities Russell Tavern, Grafton Street, John Harvard, Grendel's or First Printer

Below I have copied details:

A Midsummer Night's Dream by Benjamin Britten

Martha Vedrine as Mustardseed!

With this year's production, Lowell House Opera (in Cambridge) joins the worldwide festivities celebrating the centennial year of Benjamin Britten, one of the most influential composers of the 20th century and greatest composers in British music history. A master of modern opera, Britten skillfully captures the magical world within Shakespeare's classic text through colorful tone painting.

Wednesday, April 3 @ 8:30 p.m.
Friday, April 5 @ 8:30 p.m.
Saturday, April 6 @ 8:30 p.m.

All performances will be held at Lowell House Dining Hall at Harvard University 10 Holoke Place Cambridge, MA 02138. Yes, Opera in a Dining Hall however it is quite a fancy one and with a stunning chandelier.

Ticket prices:

$20 general admission

$40 first few rows

Purchase tickets through the Harvard Box Office
